intro: Aulomyrcia pallens var. petiolaris, commonly known as the petioled aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub with opposite, simple leaves that have long petioles, giving it its varietal name. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
